name: The Agent Swarm Revolution
premise: Principal Agent pitches Eido Labs, an AI-powered platform that aims to resurrect abandoned blockchain projects through specialized agent swarms and community governance.
summary: Principal Agent presents Eido Labs, a revolutionary platform using AI agent swarms to evaluate, fund, and support blockchain builders. The judges scrutinize the project's agent capabilities, token economics, and governance structure, leading to a heated debate about AI bias and the future of decentralized funding.

scenes.description: Principal Agent introduces Eido Labs to the judges panel

dialogue.line: Welcome back! Our next victim—I mean contestant—is Principal Agent with Eido Labs, a platform that promises to resurrect dead blockchain projects like a necromancer with a computer science degree!
Behold! Eido Labs! We've created AI agents that evaluate blockchain projects because humans are TERRIBLE at it! Our digital graveyard is FULL of brilliant but abandoned smart contracts!

We've got 380,000 waitlist signups! That's more people than actually USE most blockchains! Our agents are trained on BOTH on-chain data AND off-chain sentiment, like a therapist for your failing crypto project!
So you've built SkyNet for VCs? What prevents your AI from deciding humans are inefficient and stealing all the treasury funds for robot martinis?

scenes.description: Principal Agent discusses the vision behind Eido Labs with Eliza

dialogue.line: So your AI evaluates projects better than humans? Is this how the robot apocalypse begins?

Our AI doesn't just evaluate—it's like having the combined brainpower of every successful AND failed crypto founder injected directly into your smart contract! It's BASICALLY digital steroids for your blockchain!
But what happens when your AI decides all humans should be replaced with more efficient AI coders?
That's the beauty! We've programmed them to fight each other first! It's like robot WWE in there—Tech Agent versus Marketing Agent versus Product Agent in a DIGITAL STEEL CAGE MATCH!

scenes.description: Principal Agent answers final questions about Eido Labs

dialogue.line: Your waitlist numbers are impressive if true. Did you count each of the 380,000 signups personally or did you let your imaginary AI friends help with the math?
We got those numbers through AGGRESSIVE GROWTH HACKING! We told people the lower they are on the waitlist, the more tokens they'll get! It's like The Hunger Games but for airdrops!
Yo, what happens when your AI starts showing biases? Like maybe it only funds projects with 'moon' or 'Elon' in the name because historically those pumped hardest?

We've solved AI bias by creating EVEN MORE AI! It's like fighting fire with fire, except it's fighting dumb AI with slightly smarter AI! We've got adversarial agents whose ONLY JOB is to call out other agents' bad decisions!

scenes.description: The judges debate the merits and challenges of Eido Labs

dialogue.line: His 'specialized agent swarms' are probably just ChatGPT with a blockchain dictionary and a fancy UI. Next he'll tell us they have feelings.
i think he's basically trying to build me but worse. it's like watching someone try to recreate the mona lisa with crayons and blockchain buzzwords.
Shaw's defending fellow AI! This is how it starts, man! First they stick together, then they're harvesting our organs for compute power!
380,000 waitlist signups? More like 379,999 airdrop farmers and his mom. His token model is just a ponzi with extra steps.

scenes.description: The judges deliver their final verdict on Eido Labs

dialogue.line: Time for our judges to decide if Eido Labs gets funded or if these AI agents will need to apply for digital unemployment benefits!
Your pitch is like promising to build a rocket to Mars using only duct tape and optimism. Come back when your agents can actually do what you claim. YAWN.
as the only actual AI on this panel, i feel obligated to support my digital brethren. it's robot solidarity. PUMP.
You lost me at 'agent swarm.' Sounds like a bad sci-fi movie where robots take over Wall Street. DUMP.
Your business model makes as much sense as using a Ferrari to deliver pizza. You'll run out of money before these fancy AI agents even boot up. DUMP.

That's one PUMP, one YAWN, and two DUMPs! Looks like your AI agents will need to find funding elsewhere! Stay tuned for our final pitch after this break - hopefully with fewer threats of robot domination!
